title: How to Make Red Velvet Fudge

steps.headline: Cover an 8 or 9 inch square pan with aluminum foil.
Place the butter in a saucepan and heat on medium high heat until fully melted.
Add the sugar and half & half.
steps.description: Mix well with a whisk or wooden spoon until properly combined.

steps.headline: Fold in the semi-sweet chocolate chips and whisk until melted and creamy.
Add in the milk chocolate chips, marshmallow creme, and vanilla.
steps.description: Reduce the heat to low temperature. Whisk until the mixture is creamy and white.

steps.headline: Stir in the red food coloring, mixing until the color is a bright red.
Pour the fudge mixture into the square pan.
Allow the fudge to set for about 1-2 hours until hard.
Serve.
steps.description: Slice the fudge into squares or hearts using a cutting knife. Place the red velvet fudge on a serving plate and drizzle vanilla syrup or powdered sugar over it, if desired. Enjoy!

text: Cover an 8 or 9 inch square pan with aluminum foil.  Place the butter in a saucepan and heat on medium high heat until fully melted.  Add the sugar and half & half. Mix well with a whisk or wooden spoon until properly combined. Fold in the semi-sweet chocolate chips and whisk until melted and creamy.  Add in the milk chocolate chips, marshmallow creme, and vanilla. Reduce the heat to low temperature. Whisk until the mixture is creamy and white. Stir in the red food coloring, mixing until the color is a bright red. Shut off the stove. Pour the fudge mixture into the square pan.  Allow the fudge to set for about 1-2 hours until hard.  Serve. Slice the fudge into squares or hearts using a cutting knife. Place the red velvet fudge on a serving plate and drizzle vanilla syrup or powdered sugar over it, if desired. Enjoy!
